intro: Alsine pilifera, commonly known as the hairy alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Alsine pilifera is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
